name: St. Alphonsus Liguori

locations.description: Founder of the Redemptorists, Bishop of Sant'Agata dei Goti

summary: Alphonsus Liguori was an Italian Catholic bishop, spiritual writer, composer, musician, artist, poet, lawyer, scholastic philosopher, and theologian. He founded the Congregation of the Most Holy Redeemer (Redemptorists) in 1732. He is best known for his moral theology, particularly his work on casuistry and probabilism. He was declared a Doctor of the Church in 1871 and is the patron saint of confessors, moral theologians, and vocations.
keyQuotes: He who does not acquire the love of God will scarcely persevere in the grace of God, for it is very difficult to renounce sin merely through fear of chastisement.
The more a person loves God, the more reason he has to hope in Him.
